title: [BUG] `SKImage.FromBitmap(someBitmap)` returns null (on macOS) with SkiaSharp 1.68.0 and 1.68.1
body:
**Description**

`SKImage.FromBitmap(someBitmap)` returns null, on macOS (with a someBitmap variable that is not null). Strangely enough, this happens when upgrading Xamarin.Forms from 3.0 (3.0.0.446417) to the latest 4.3 (4.3.0.991211). [Been bisecting this, and regression seems to happen somewhere between 3.6.709228, the last v3.6.x, and 4.0.0.425677, the first v4.0.x]

**Code**

https://github.com/knocte/geewallet/blob/b0dcca50c1fab8010e8376afea566763a1b5b8ec/src/GWallet.Frontend.XF/Controls/DonutChartView.fs#L252

**Expected Behavior**

This method shouldn't return null (it doesn't with XamarinForms 3.6).

**Actual Behavior**

It returns null, so my app ends up crashing with a NullReferenceException.

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  1.68.0 (tried upgrading to SkiaSharp.1.68.1 but it doesn't fix it).
- Last known good version:  1.68.0 along with Xamarin.Forms 3.6
- IDE:  Visual Studio for Mac 8.3.9.2
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - macOS:  Catalina 10.15.1
- Target Devices:  macBook

**Reproduction Link**

Run the macOS app in this branch: https://github.com/knocte/geewallet/commits/experiments/xf4
